qas.question: How many are estimated people live in Burma officially?

answers.text: provisional results of the 2014 Myanmar Census show that the total population is 51,419,420

qas.question: Who may have been left out of the 2014 census in Burma ?

answers.text: an estimated 1,206,353 persons in parts of northern Rakhine State, Kachin State and Kayin State who were not counted.

qas.question: How many people in Burma are currently using a work visa for Thailand?

answers.text: 600,000 registered migrant workers from Myanmar in Thailand

qas.question: How many of the Burmese  people are predicted to work in Thailand without authorization
What percentage of emigrant workers in Thailand that are from Myanmar ?

context: The <a0_0>provisional results of the 2014 Myanmar Census show that the total population is 51,419,420<a0_0/>. This figure includes <a1_0>an estimated 1,206,353 persons in parts of northern Rakhine State, Kachin State and Kayin State who were not counted.<a1_0/> People who were out of the country at the time of the census are not included in these figures. There are over <a2_0>600,000 registered migrant workers from Myanmar in Thailand<a2_0/>, and <a3_0>millions more work illegally<a3_0/>. Burmese migrant workers account for <a4_0>80% of Thailand's migrant workers<a4_0/>. Population density is 76 per square kilometre (200/sq mi), among the lowest in Southeast Asia.
